Author: princess-kitty-belle
Text: It depends on your age when you were that weight- bodies naturally change over time so it may not look exactly like your pre ed body and thats okay- recovery is about learning to embrace those changes and taking the focus off what you weigh.  It's also really normal for people to overshoot weight targets as the body is healing and then gradually drop some weight while eating intuitively. This doesn't mean getting "fat" for everyone- I think megsy recovery on youtube talks about the concept of a "recovery body" being just what your body needs to look like while it's recovering and trying to accept that.

Author: hondaceviche
Text: There's a good chance you'll be just fine, especially if you're smart about your macros and exercise and take things slow.  If that's the weight your body "likes" to be, you'll probably stay somewhere near there, but take it slow and give your metabolism time to adjust.
